title: MySQLATAN()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLATAN()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the arc tangent of a number:
SELECT ATAN(2.5);

Definition and Usage
The ATAN() function returns the arc tangent of one or two numbers.
Syntax
ATAN(
number
)
OR:
ATAN(
a, b
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
A numeric value
a, b
Two numeric values to calculate the arc tangent of
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the arc tangent of two values:
SELECT ATAN(-0.8, 2);

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLATAN()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLATAN()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples.
